title: How to Hint In on Someone That You Like Them

steps.headline: Make eye contact, then smile at them.
steps.description: When you see your crush, meet their gaze and maintain eye contact for 2-3 seconds. As soon as they look back at you, smile at them to subtly flirt. This hints to them that you might be crushing on them. See if they smile back at you. This might mean they like you, too. Don’t make eye contact for longer than 2-3 seconds because they might feel like you’re staring.

steps.headline: Wave and say “hi” when they walk by you.
steps.description: If you’re feeling bold, get their attention when they pass by you. Give them a quick wave, smile, and say, “Hi.” Then, keep walking toward your destination. For instance, you might wave at them while you’re walking to class. Don’t pause or slow down. This way, you’re only putting yourself out there for a few seconds. Do this a couple of times to see if they start waving back.

steps.headline: Lean toward them while they’re talking.
steps.description: When you lean toward someone, it shows them that you really care about what they have to say. Make a point to lean in your crush’s direction whenever you get a chance to talk to them. This will hint to them that you like them. For example, let’s say you’re sitting near your crush in the cafeteria. Lean in their direction to show you’re focused on what they have to say. If your crush leans away from you, give them their personal space. Try not to let this hurt your feelings, as there are several reasons they might lean away.

steps.headline: Like all of their social media posts.
steps.description: Liking all of someone’s posts instantly sends the message that you might like them. Check out their page every day so you can like their posts. This shows them that you’re paying attention to them and like what you see. Only like their new posts. Don’t go back and like all of their old posts because it can make them uncomfortable.

steps.headline: Touch them casually on their arm, shoulder, or knee.
steps.description: Touching is a great way to show someone you like them without saying it. When you’re talking to them, lightly touch their arm, shoulder, or knee for 1-2 seconds. Watch how they react to see if they feel comfortable with your touch. If they seem comfortable, try touching them again. For instance, you might ask the person to explain an assignment to you. While they’re talking, lean in close and lightly touch their arm. If the person flinches, pulls away, or sinks under your touch, they probably don’t like it, so stop touching them immediately. It’s important to respect people’s personal space.

steps.headline: Compliment them every time you see them.
steps.description: Your crush likely enjoys hearing nice things about themself. Make a habit of picking out something different about them to compliment each time you see them. Focus your compliments on things they can change, like their outfit, their hairstyle, and their hobbies. Additionally, recognize when they make an achievement. Say something like, “You smell really good today,” “Great job on your presentation,” “This hairstyle looks awesome on you,” or “I like your shirt.”

steps.headline: Give them a special nickname that only you call them.
steps.description:
Playful nicknames are often a sign of a close relationship, so giving them a nickname can hint that you like them as more than friends. Think about the things you like most about your crush or inside jokes you’ve had in the past. Then, pick a cute nickname to call them. For instance, let’s say the person is a dancer and their favorite animal is penguins. You might start calling them, “Happy Feet.” Similarly, if your crush once baked cookies for the whole class, you could start calling them “Chef.”
Make sure that you pick a nice nickname and not something mean. For instance, you wouldn’t want to start calling your crush “Frizz” because some people might think you’re teasing them. Stop using the nickname if your crush gets upset or asks you to stop.Variation: If you feel uncomfortable giving them a nickname, use their name a lot when you’re talking to them. People love hearing their own name, so this can hint that you like them.

steps.headline: Ask them to take a selfie with you when you’re hanging out.
steps.description:
When you’re spending time with your crush, try to get them to take a selfie with you. Snapping a pic together creates an intimate moment and means you have to lean in close together. It also sends them a subtle hint that you might be crushing on them. For instance, let’s say you’re at a house party that your crush is attending. When you run into them, say something like, “It’s great to see you! Will you be in my snap?”
Similarly, you might be studying in the library when your crush comes in. Say, “Hey, I see I’m not the only one studying. Want to take a pic to document how studious we are?”

steps.headline: Send them a text to start a conversation.
steps.description:
Write out a brief text that includes a question. This way, they have to either respond or ignore you. If they respond, text them back to keep the conversation going. You might say, “What topic did you pick for the research paper?” “What did you think of last week’s episode of Riverdale?” or “What are you doing this weekend?”
If they ignore you, try not to feel hurt. They might just be too busy with other things to text you back. However, it may be best to focus on someone who has time for you.Variation: If you don’t have their phone number, try to message them through social media. For instance, you might send them snaps on Snapchat.

steps.headline: Return their texts as soon as your receive them.
steps.description: Sending a quick response to their text messages shows them that you care about them. Do your best to send them a quick reply when they send a text. This will subtly hint that you like them. If you have to delay a response, tell them why. Say, “Sorry for the delayed response, but I was driving.”Warning: Don’t break a rule or put yourself in danger to return a text. For instance, don’t text and drive or text in class if phones are banned. Wait until it’s safe and appropriate to text.

steps.headline: Text them a photo and say it made you think of them.
steps.description: Use a silly photo that you took on your phone or search for a funny meme. Then, send them the photo with a caption that says something like, “This is you,” “Aw! This made me think of you,” or “This was us last night.” This will hint that you might think of them as more than a friend. Keep in mind that this can be normal for friends to do, as well. You’ll probably need to flirt with them in other ways to make it clear you like them.Variation: If you snapped a photo of them or the 2 of you together, send them that photo with a nice caption. You might say, "Thought I'd send you this photo of the goal you scored" or "We look so chill in this photo."

steps.headline: Talk about how much fun you had the last time you saw them.
steps.description: When you spend time with them, send them a follow-up text to let them know you enjoyed it. Additionally, compliment them on something they did or said. This allows you to subtly flirt with them without being too obvious. Say, “You looked really cute today,” "I can't believe you're such a great dancer!" or "I like spending time with you because you're so funny!"

steps.headline: Send them a hypothetical question about a possible relationship.
steps.description: A hypothetical question lets you hint to them that you're interested in dating them. Ask them a question about how they would think or feel about going on a date, touching, or kissing. Then, see how they respond. Text something like, “What would you do if I asked to come over?” "What do you think our first kiss would be like?" or "What meme makes you think of me the most?"

steps.headline: Tell them directly that you like them.
steps.description: Once you've been flirting via text for awhile, you might get up the courage to say you like them. Send them a text saying what you like about them. Then, see how they respond. If their response is positive, send another flirty message. If they don't seem interested, change the subject. You might text them, “You're so cute,” "I feel like you're my dream girl come to life," or "I can't stop thinking about you."

steps.headline: Go to their games, events, or performances.
steps.description: Pay attention to the activities that your crush enjoys doing. Then, attend their special events to show your support. Additionally, cheer them on and congratulate them when they do well. For instance, attend your crush’s soccer game or the play they’re starring in.

steps.headline: Offer to help them or to do them a favor.
steps.description: Doing something to help someone shows them that you care about them. Step up to help if you see them struggling with something. Alternatively, tell them that you’d be happy to help them get better at something you’re really good at doing. As an example, offer to carry their books, help them pick up papers they’ve dropped, or lend them a pencil when they need it. Similarly, you might offer to tutor them in math if you hear them say they’re struggling. If you were good at origami, you might show them how to fold a paper crane.

steps.headline: Make them a mixed tape or playlist.
steps.description: Giving someone a mixed tape or playlist sends a clear signal that you probably like them. Choose 10-15 of your favorite songs to include on the mixed tape or playlist. Hand them the tape or place it in their bag or locker. If you made a playlist, send them a link. Don’t fill the playlist with love songs because that can feel off-putting to someone you aren’t dating yet. Try to pick songs that you think they might enjoy.

steps.headline: Ask them to hang out as friends.
steps.description:
It’s really hard to ask your crush out, so start with a friendly hang. Invite them to study, to do an activity you both like, or to attend a group outing or party. Then, use this time to get to know them better. This can hint that you’re interested without you putting yourself out there. Say something like, “I definitely need more study time before this test. Do you want to meet me at the coffee house for a study session?” “Did you see that our favorite band is playing this Friday? Did you want to go with me?” or “Some of us are going bowling on Friday. Do you want to come?”
If they say, “No,” brush it off like it’s no big deal. You could say, “Let me know if you change your mind. I might invite some other friends in the meantime.”

steps.headline: Give them a small gift on their birthday or a special event.
steps.description: A thoughtful gift shows your crush that you’re thinking of them. Look for a reason to give them something small. It might be their birthday, a holiday, or a shared event. This will show them that you like them. For example, you might give them a bag of candy for Halloween or Homecoming.
